at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConnectionControl

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements IConnectionControl
    The main class of this Server.
    It implements the IConnectionControl interface, which means control of connections is maintained by another component, making this part of the server a trusted environment with the other component deciding which devices to allow connection. Information of allowed links between PhoneConnections and CarConnections is stored in the whitelist. A PhoneConnection can only be allowed control over exactly one CarConnection at one point in time. If an entry in the whitelist is removed or gets overridden, the affected PhoneConnection loses control over the car it is currently connected to, if any.

    TODO This section needs to be updated. Other threads (e.g. the connection acceptor or different connection-type-classes) can inform this class about new events (e.g. new connection, connect-request, etc.) via the operationQueue.
    It starts a PhoneConnectionAcceptor and CarConnectionAcceptor in new threads and waits for new Connections to be accepted.
    The new connections are stored in a PhoneConnection or CarConnection (depending on the ConnectionAcceptor), which are started in a new thread and stored in the list of unidentified devices.
    Before those connections are able to interact with the server, they need to register themselves with an id to be able to easily identify them. In order for PhoneConnections to be able to maintain a connection, they need to be whitelisted via the IConnectionControl-interface.

    PhoneConnections can send requests to the server to be connected (linked) with or disconnected from a CarConnection, but only if the phone has been granted access control over that car (again via making use of the IConnectionControl-interface). The server then searches in the list of connected cars for a car with the corresponding ID and links it to the phone, regardless of the previous connection state of the car (a previously connected phone gets disconnected).
    An existing link between a phone and a car can be terminated at any time by removing the corresponding entry from the whitelist. This can be done via the IConnectionControl-interface.
    If a connection is closed, its corresponding thread finishes and it is removed from identifiedDevices or unidentifiedDevices, whichever applies.
    Author:
    Boeck

        Parameters:

      • addUnidentifiedDevice

        private void addUnidentifiedDevice(Connection connection)
        Adds the passed Connection to unidentifiedDevices, removing any already contained Connections with the same device.
        Parameters:
        connection - the Connection to be added to unidentifiedDevices.

      • identifyDevice

        private void identifyDevice(Connection connection)
        Takes a Connection and adds it to the list of identified devices. PhoneConnections can only be added, if an entry in the whitelist exists for that phone, otherwise the registration will be rejected and the connection closed.
        The registering device is informed, if the process has been successful or not.
        Parameters:
        connection - The Connection to be registered.

      • linkDevices

        private void linkDevices(Connection connection)
        Tries to establish a link between a PhoneConnection and a CarConnection.
        The passed connection has to be the PhoneConnection that requested control over a car. If that requirement is met, and the PhoneConnection has permission to be linked with the car, the corresponding CarConnection is searched for in the list of identifiedDevices. If the car is found, a link between the two devices is established.
        The PhoneConnection is informed of the success of the operation.
        Parameters:
        connection - the PhoneConnection to be linked to a car.

      • removeDevice

        private void removeDevice(Connection connection)
        Removes the passed Connection either from unidentifiedDevices or identifiedDevices, whichever list contains the element.
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to be removed from the lists of connected devices.

      • updateCarInformations

        private void updateCarInformations(Connection connection)
        Checks if the passed Connection is an instance of a CarConnection and updates carInformations with the passed CarConnections car information, if so. If getCarInformations() contains a CarInformation with the same id as the new one, it gets overridden.
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection that should be checked for a new CarInformation.

      • processQueueElement

        private void processQueueElement(QueueElement nextOperation)
        Takes a QueueElement and processes its Connection based on the EOperationType.
        Parameters:
        nextOperation - the QueueElement to be processed.
